TopicTitle: [1.12.5] Bluedog Design Bureau - Stockalike Saturn, Apollo, and more! (v1.13.0 "Забытый" 13/Aug/2023)

Articles.Content:
MB60 is now on github. This was a proposal for future Delta IV and H2A upgrades and briefly was considered for SLS' EUS (in a 2x form)

The engine is an expander bleed design with additional boost pumps for high chamber pressure. The bleed exhaust is injected in the nozzle extension for film cooling which recovers some Isp from the open cycle. Pictured here on an improved Delta IV heavy with regen RS68 engines. The film cooling also allows the use of a simple sheet metal nozzle extension. Mitsubishi stated 467s Isp ( maybe optimistic?), the name is from the 60k lbf thrust target. There was also a smaller MB-35 variant not modelled here. An RL10B2 makes 24.7k lbf.

 

2x MB60 was considered for EUS for a short while. 2 would produce more thrust than 4x RL10s.

Absolutely impressive, my favorite upper stage engine!

Updated to the latest version via CKAN and MM is saying there's 4 errors related to one of the configs. I don't know enough about MM to go and fix them myself, so if someone could take a look it would be greatly appreciated.

MB-60 on the HIIA

17 minutes ago, Naeth Kerman said:

There is a subtype with a different overlap if that is what you are referring to.

It is, but there isn't. You might be thinking of the 1.875 interstage that has several subtypes.

57 minutes ago, Rodger said:

Do you have DeadlyReentry installed? If so, this is fixed in dev.

I do, thank you. I'll ignore it then until the next full update. It didn't seem to affect anything.

6 minutes ago, Taki117 said:

I do, thank you. I'll ignore it then until the next full update. It didn't seem to affect anything.

The only things to watch out for would be the Apollo advanced heatshield with the landing legs, and the Venus Flyby Probe. Both of those part's heat shields would not work.

If you want to fix it to make your loading screen look nicer in the meantime, download this file (right-click and save as):

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/CobaltWolf/Bluedog-Design-Bureau/1.11-development/Gamedata/Bluedog_DB/Patches/Thermal/engines.cfg

And replace the one in your Gamedata/Bluedog_DB/Patches/Thermal/ folder

 

@OrbitalManeuvers

On dev branch now. Not the ideal situation with the black bits of AO showing, but good enough imo.

On 11/1/2022 at 5:06 PM, Beccab said:

Would it be possible to add a variant to the S-IVB docking port where the engine side port doesn't have that gray structure? If it's used with more than 1 engine most times the ports can actually dock with each other, but the structure is clipping with some of the engines

Cobalt just split up the mesh, so I've set this up and is now on dev.

I originally was not gonna take pictures of this reentry test flight for a possible sample return mission but I changed my mind when I found out we were launching during a Munar Eclipse.

First Gen Atlas rockets make great cheap launch vehicles for reentry test especially since I don't have to waste a Titan.

Edited November 4, 2022 by Pudgemountain

So still building my new ISS station.   Just started launching the russian Segment...  Utilizing Delta IV Heavy UPG...

I am not posting a full album but I thought I would share this:

 

Twin MB-60 DCSS.   Had to toe the engines out by 5 degrees so they wouldn't hit each other but it works and it fits!

 

Now if the damn game wouldn't quit crashing when I get this NEAR the space station!

21 minutes ago, Pappystein said:

And I thought my centrifuge stations causing framerate dips was bad. Ouch.

2 hours ago, Pappystein said:

Now if the damn game wouldn't quit crashing when I get this NEAR the space station!

You think that's bad. Last night I was doing a trial run of a Sample return probe when for no reason the Kraken unleashed itself on the return trip, crashed the game and forced me into a hard restart of my computer.

While still working on a sample return vessel we decided to extend the Mercury Lab's life support system capable to last months.

The LS tanks are different color to distinguish the supplies and waste.

Nothing lab related but I still love the Waterfall effects of the Retro motors.

Overall Erly Kerman has lasted a total of 90 days in orbit and currently holds the record for longest stay in space. As for cabin fever thank the Kraken that Erly is a Introvert.

On a technical note I did have decals on the vessel and rocket but for some reason Conform Decals keep going invisible during launch.
Just fooling around to make sure everything is in order post 1.12.4 update. Also SATURN MLV FOR LIFE!!!
Is it just me or does the Big G service module seem a bit too reflective (for lack of a better word). Note the other white greebles on the part versus the main body

INT-21 launch of a 10 meters diameter space station
